content.text: During April the probability that it will rain on any one day is \(\frac{5}{6}\)
On how many of the 30 days in April would it be expected to rain?
one hundred and five thousand and two
Write your answer to part (a) correct to the nearest ten thousand
Insert one pair of brackets into each calculation to make the answer correct
Write the following in order of size, starting with the smallest
Thomas fills glasses from a jug containing 2.4 litres of water
How many glasses can Thomas fill?
Martha divides $240 between spending and saving in the ratio
Calculate the amount Martha has for spending
From the list of numbers, find
Calculate the selling price of a bicycle bought for \(\) 120\(and sold at a profit of\) 15\%\$
issues: Escaped dollar outside math mode: ...t a profit of\) 15\%\$...
Escaped dollar outside math mode: ...t a profit of\) 15\%\$...

content.text: Write down the upper bound of the population
The population of a city is 128 000, correct to the nearest thousand
Pedro invested \(800 at a rate of 5\%\) per year compound interest
Calculate the total amount he has after 2 years
For her holiday, Dina changed 500 Swiss francs (CHF) into pounds (£)
Calculate how much Dina received in pounds
Give your answer correct to 2 decimal places
The scale of a map is \(1:500\,000\)
On the map the centres of two cities are \(26\mathrm{cm}\) apart
Calculate the actual distance, in kilometres, between the centres of the two cities
Write down all the steps of your working
the difference between the highest temperature and the lowest temperature,
In Vienna, the mid-day temperatures, in \(^\circ \mathrm{C}\), are recorded during a week in December
The diagram shows a circular pool of radius \(2.5 \mathrm{~m}\)
A square piece of land surrounds the pool
Each side of the square is \(8\mathrm{m}\) long
Calculate the shaded area of the land that surrounds the pool
Write down the mathematical name for the quadrilateral \(ABCD\)
In the quadrilateral \(ABCD\), \(AB = AD\) and \(CB = CD\)
Work out \((8 \times 10^{6})^{2}\), giving your answer in standard form
On the grid, mark the point \(B\)
\(M\) is the midpoint of the line \(BD\)
The diagram shows two points \(A\) (-5, 2) and \(M\) (2, -3)
In triangle \(ABC, D\) is on \(AB\) so that angle \(ADC =\) angle \(BDC = 90^\circ\)
